<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_suspend_connection:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_suspend_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;

#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS
  mhd_assert ( (! MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon)) || \
               MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_ (daemon) || \
               MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (daemon->tid) );
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot suspend connections without " \
                  "enabling MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
#ifdef UPGRADE_SUPPORT
  if (NULL != connection->urh)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Error: connection scheduled for \"upgrade\" cannot " \
                 "be suspended.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    return;
  }
#endif /* UPGRADE_SUPPORT */
  internal_suspend_connection_ (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment in the provided function modifies the parameter variable 'connection' itself. The function only reads fields via 'connection->...', assigns one field value to a new local pointer 'daemon' (struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;), performs comparisons and calls helper/macros, and passes 'connection' to internal_suspend_connection_. Rule 17.8 forbids modifying the parameter variable (e.g. reassigning 'connection' or incrementing it). There are no assignments to 'connection' nor uses that change the pointer value. Modifying the object pointed to (the struct contents) is permitted; internal_suspend_connection_ may alter the pointee, which is allowed by the rule. The macros used (mhd_assert, MHD_PANIC, MHD_DLOG) do not take 'connection' as an lvalue in this code and therefore do not modify the parameter. Consequently, there are no fragments requiring investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
